meanings.definition: A sovereign ruler of great power and rank, especially one ruling an empire.
meanings.sent1: The ancient emperors commanded vast territories and armies.
meanings.sent2: The emperors of Rome were known for their luxurious lifestyles.
meanings.sent3: The emperors decided to have a race to see who could eat the most grapes in one minute.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, the CEO is often seen as the emperor of the company.
meanings.sent5: The emperors wore majestic robes adorned with gold and jewels.

meanings.definition: A male monarch of the highest rank and title.
meanings.sent1: The emperors of old were respected and feared by their subjects.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the new emperor was crowned with a magnificent crown.
meanings.sent3: The emperors gathered for a grand feast to celebrate their victories.
meanings.sent4: He ruled his household like an emperor, expecting everyone to obey his commands.
meanings.sent5: The emperor's portrait hung proudly in the great hall of the palace.
